metadata.Title: CVE-2015-6761 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The update_dimensions function in libavcodec/vp8.c in FFmpeg through 2.8.1, as used in Google Chrome before 46.0.2490.71 and other products, relies on a coefficient-partition count during multi-threaded operation, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (race condition and memory corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted WebM file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6761` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-browser-l10n - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-chromedriver - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ebarretto> as of 2018-09-27, no equivalent fix in libav.

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106').
libav: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
